info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:34AM CDT until August 12 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CALHOUN...WESTERN MADISON...SOUTHWESTERN MACOUPIN AND JERSEY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS...ST. CHARLES... NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...EAST CENTRAL FRANKLIN AND ST. LOUIS COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL MISSOURI AND ST. LOUIS CITY... At 434 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hardin to near Orchard Farms to near Maryland Heights to near Augusta, moving southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... St. Louis, O`Fallon, St. Charles, St. Peters, Florissant, Chesterfield, Wildwood, University City, Ballwin, Wentzville, Alton, Kirkwood, Maryland Heights, Hazelwood, Webster Groves, Ferguson, Arnold, Manchester, Godfrey, and Creve Coeur. This also includes Babler Memorial State Park, Scott Joplin Historic Site, Route 66 State Park, Castlewood State Park, Confluence State Park, Mastodon Historic Site, First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site, and Pere Marquette State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 257 and 277. Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 185 and 191. Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 203 and 231. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
